titleStmt.title: The Full examination of six suspected Catholick gentlemen brought before the Lord mayor and aldermen, who were seized for dispersing the late King James's declaration : as also a relation of the death of a Scotch papist gentlemnan named Charles Stuart, Laird of Castleton, who murder'd himself at Mr. Walter Davis house ... who was suspected as a confederate with the aforesaid gentlemen in dispersing the said declaration.

The Full examination of six suspected Catholick gentlemen brought before the Lord mayor and aldermen, who were seized for dispersing the late King James's declaration : as also a relation of the death of a Scotch papist gentlemnan named Charles Stuart, Laird of Castleton, who murder'd himself at Mr. Walter Davis house ... who was suspected as a confederate with the aforesaid gentlemen in dispersing the said declaration.

notesStmt.note: Reproduction of original in the Huntington Library.
